column5: after wanting to get one for quite some time and recently seeing once again how effective it can be i finally bit the bullet and picked up my first centerpin. i picked up the okuma aventa and a 13' st. croix avid. took thursday off in hopes to break it in and it was quite a successful day. ended up going 6 for 9. heres a few pics
Awesome for your first outing, nice fish!  Enjoy it, they're a lot of fun
SWEET MILLER    Wished I lived closer to that riv.
WTG, Haven't seen ya around your local haunts this fall, looks like you have upgraded locations a little bit.  Is that the combo that I saw at Grimsby Tackle?  Cheers,  Clarence
i fished my usual spots a bunch this fall just not in the past couple weeks, and no the one we have at the shop is with a 10'6" streamside rod, i grabbed a 13' st. croix avid
Are you working there now?  Clarence
nice shootin!! ....hope you enjoy your new technique....steelies are alot of fun ...but .....just wait till you hook into a King on the pin...
yep started there a little over 3 months ago now
Sweet outing outing Miller, i like the last fish...pretty stout and the brown has amazing markings on the gill plate.  Congrats
Took me about 10 trips before I got my very first a couple years back. Haven't gotten one since. That's great you went 6 for 9. Go get them again soon!
Congratulations on your outing. I know the rings on your rod fit tight but I would strongly recommend that you tape them in place so you can't knock one loose and have your reel fall off.
